content: In HaxBall, players face off in simplistic-looking 2D soccer matches. While playing or watching a HaxBall match, a user can select Menu → Rec to start recording that match. When the user is done recording, they can select Menu → Rec again to save their recording as an HBR2 file.

HaxBall includes an HBR2 player, which users can access by selecting Replays from the game's Room list screen. Additionally, enterprising HaxBall enthusiasts have created several custom replay utilities, including custom players and replay analyzers.
NOTE: Prior to the introduction of the HBR2 format, HaxBall replays were saved as HBR (.hbr) files.

description: An HBR2 file is a replay created by HaxBall, an online soccer game. It contains a recording of a HaxBall match. Players and spectators can create HBR2 files while playing or watching a match.

instructions: You can open an HBR2 file with several HaxBall replay players, including the default player included with HaxBall. To open an HBR2 file with HaxBall's replay player:
Go to HaxBall's Room list screen.
Navigate to and open your HBR2 file.
The replay your HBR2 file contains will then begin playing.
If you want to both watch and view statistics about your HBR2 replay, you can do so with Haxball Replay Analyzer.
